results.title: Experiments in the revival of organisms (D)
results.brief_description: A record of successful Russian experiments in resuscitating dead animals. The apparatus used is shown and the resuscitation of a dead dog illustrated step by step. The film raises question about the true physiological nature of death. WARNING: CONTAINS DISTURBING SCENES OF ANIMAL EXPERIMENTATION.
results.description: A record of successful Russian experiments in resuscitating dead animals. The apparatus used is shown and the resuscitation of a dead dog illustrated step by step. results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Victor Lockwood, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Rhys L.L. Davies demonstrates his innovative method of teaching fractions to primary school children. He discusses the methodology he used to test his method against traditional text books and Quizinnaire. Shows Rhys using the three methods with his students in class.

results.title: Experimental design
results.creator_credit: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Against all odds: inside statistics”.
Theresa M. Amabile introduces this first program on the design and conduct of experiments. She discusses the distinction between observational studies and experiments, the concept of control groups to reduce the risk of confounding results and randomized comparative experiments. Examples used are studies of lobsters and how they communicate, the use of aspirin in reducing the incidence of heart attacks and how the police should deal with cases of domestic violence.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Singer, Peggy Girshman, Chedd-Angier Productions and COMAP

results.title: Experimental
results.creator_credit: Robin Lehman and R A Films
results.brief_description: A quirky history of experimental flight - hang-gliding and helicopters intercut with historical footage, student pranks and a Concorde with a mothergoose smile. Prize winner at 1975 Melbourne Film Festival.

results.title: Experiment in teaching
results.creator_credit: Lawrence Crabb, James Carr, Department of Education and Science (UK) and World Wide
results.brief_description: A description of new methods of teaching applied science in schools, with particular reference to engineering and technology. The film visits a number of schools including the Technical Activities Centre at Sevenoaks School and Cray Valley Technical High School where practical interest in such projects as making a steam engine, and a go-kart, encourage theoretical study. The common objective of these courses is to develop the pupils’ creative qualities of imaginative thought.

results.title: Experiment in romance
results.creator_credit: Robert Sdraulig and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Clive, an insulated academic, gets a taste of “La Dolce Vita”. What happens subsequently is limited only by his imagination. Cast includes: Marie-Louise Walker, James Reyne and John Howard. Camera by Michael Bladen.

results.title: Experienced hands: a study in continuing education
results.creator_credit: Theodore Conant, Tom Daly, Elspeth Chisholm and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The story of the Quo Vadis School of Nursing in Toronto, which trains older women - most of them housewives and mothers - to become graduate nurses. They help to alleviate the shortage of nurses, and Toronto hospitals welcome their mature presence in the wards. This film describes the project during its first experimental year.
